"How are you fealing Wing?" Lunarpine asked, his thoughts and smile 
both filled with relief that she pulled through. He looked up and 
down her new form. It was bigger than he was and it looked twice as 
powerful. Lunarpine tried to hide his thoughts but knew she could 
read how impressed he was.

Veratis stepped forward with a microscanner designed to break down 
every cell in her body. Her cells showed traces of the virus but they 
were quickly being treated like more of a flu than a fatal 
virus. "You'll be fine in a day or so." He set the scanner back on 
his workbench, turned in an almost poetic motion. Glad you're back my 
dear." His words were gentle and secureing but his thoughts were not. 
His thoughts were angry with her He wanted to know how she could 
storm off like that knowing she'd been infected with the virus. How 
dare she risk putting him through that kind of grief again.


OOC Well I gotta get some sleep, I hope I gave the ones who bother to 
read this something to think about.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> Ice::
> 
> The virus had finally stopped working and her immune system started 
> to adjust. Her body finally finished it's mutation and her open 
> wounds healed. She slowly awoke in the chamber. Her form was as it 
> was, polar bear with the the ability to chanbe the head into a bot 
> head. She looked around inside the chamber.  The virus in her was 
now 
> nullified and no longer existant and her body was now immune to the 
> virus.
> 
> She opened the door to the chamber and lumbered out. Still a little 
> drowsy from the seditive, but awake. She stood up on her hind legs 
> and changed into semi bot form. She looked at Lunarpine and Veratis.
> Her robotic eyes looking back and forth between the two bots.
> She was still nervouse about being caged up. She wasn't sure if the 
> virus inside her was still active.
